intro: Pycreus, commonly known as the fairy lantern, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, umbel-like inflorescence composed of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces unique, inflated fruit capsules that resemble tiny lanterns, giving it its common name. Pycreus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its botanical features make it a striking addition to gardens and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
